text: I used to see that a while ago but not anymore. I assume there is possibility to revert to the old interface anymore.

Hello people, i have a problem with the indexation of my blog entries... Google is catching every article post on my blog with a number instead the post title and i was trying to find a way or an option to this from COS but doesn´t look that be that easy... Does anyone have any clue or solution about this??? I really appreciate if you can help me. Regards :smile:

jQuery is not defined: can anyone help with this? Its fine on this page <http://www.moonoia.com/db-become-a-partner> but not this page which uses the default template   <http://www.moonoia.com/db-solutions>
looks like jquery is being loaded on the page multiple times. I'd remove it from your modules/templates since it's already loaded by HubSpot
remove it from the coded template that's located here: Custom/page/V2/includes/foot.html

I was wondering if anyone had tried to implement a filter feature on the client side to allow the user to select two criteria and search/filter the content on the website for items that match this criteria.
I’ve done similar but we ended up hardcoding the search query it actually submits to produce the best results
basically we used javascript to go `if this term and this term, use this search query`
Did you have any issues with the tagging/categorization with content in the CMS?  We'd like to filter our blogs, webinars, feature sheets etc.
the way we did it we didn’t need to tag/categorize the content, we were just utilizing the search feature’s relevancy

doing what you want to do regarding filtering blogs webinars etc, I recommend if you’re not already in there go to <#C9LPMCT35|site-search-feedback> a commonly asked question is how to filter down to just one blog/ path or similar, that sounds right up your alley.
Thanks it was included in the footer also

Is anyone having issues being able to edit modules within the Editor (i.e., we can't delete any modules or even get the edit box to shows when we hover over anything)? My initial gut was saying we added some bad JS and it's throwing the HS editor for a loop and causing issues, but it's happening across multiple accounts now and i'm wondering if its not our fault
THANK YOU!
<@UDFSF3N1F> I’m having issues too
pages not showing correctly - not able to edit modules - same issues
Are there any known issues that HubSpot is working on right now <@U6GNQ7JBU>?
<https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/nrbys9gy79xy?utm_source=slack>
Thanks <@U6GNQ7JBU>
rock on
should we avoid making changes during this time to avoid making things worse?
Changes are saving they are just propagating very slowly

Am I nuts, or is it not possible to publish a translated home page to <http://domain.com/de|domain.com/de> instead of <http://domain.com/de/home|domain.com/de/home>?

I'm getting a publishing error when I try to publish my translations without anything else on the url
Nevermind... just nuts
Is there any way to force a site-wide cache refresh?
no, not from our end, but if there’s a serious problem LSong might be your guy (didn’t tag him  because idk that something is actually going wrong with the caching)
Say you make some CSS fix to a site breaking bug and you need it to show across the site right away. This is hypothetical, I’m not in danger.
I wish there were a button
if that happens and the 15-30 minute wait is too long, and showing the client the cachebuster url doesn’t make them happy
then there isn’t much you can do unfortunately. you could maybe try adding a style tag in the head of your templates or something until your css has propagated
I didn’t realize that the module-level CSS and JS was cached too
everything’s cached.

would be nice, but from HS’s perspective, they’d rather nail the caching problems completely on their end so we don’t need to think about it.

We’re just kinda in a transition phase on the way to cache perfection
:dollar: :dollar: :dollar: :dollar: :dollar:
hey <@U7SL518D6>.. just following back up on this, do you have to be at a certain level in order to see that mp4 url? .. any way you can show us what settings you have in HubSpot so we can compare

I’ll be honest I don’t know the answer to that. I don’t have any special video related settings set.

Most of the portals I work on are Pro and up. So I’m not usually restricted for most things.
if you use the file picker field however like i stated, you might be able to get the URL through that
:money_with_wings:  all the things
hm okay thanks
Took me a little to reply <@UFC6BLEAV> - but I’ll get one setup. Thanks for the idea
i was able to figure it out
by unchecking allow embedding, sharing and tracking.. does that completely stop tracking since we are using an mp4?
well when you use an mp4 directly you don’t get the tracking I would assume.
if you want the tracking you’ll have to upgrade HubSpot plans or pay for the vidyard plan

and you have to use their embed code.

If you don’t care so much about the special vidyard features the mp4 method will work just fine
i believe the client wants to still be able to use the default tracking which means we probably cant use the mp4 way

trying to improve  code quality.  how is everyone currently handling mobile menus vs desktop menus for headers. are you essentially having 2 separate sets of html, and showing/hiding them?

I realize that’s bad practice and want to avoid that. just think overhauling my mobile nav system feels like a lot of work
then you’ll have to upgrade
I use 2 separate sets and even multiple advanced menus because of how popular mega navs are
that’s kinda what I’m leaning toward continuing to do
just feels dirty
Embrace the dirt
<https://media.giphy.com/media/xsBQDCFF4B2YU/giphy.gif>
Just wait until mega-navs go out of style and *GIGA-NAV* s are in.
oh gawd, what’s a giganav
They don’t exist yet, but I imagine it to be a nav so incredibly huge that you could fit entire enterprise sites inside them.
lol
You’ll have to put your laptop on a bag of ice before you hover over a top link
Legend
